questions.question: 1) The voltage measured in the simulator with the combinations Anolyte: Wastewater, PEM: Nutrient agar with Bacillus subtilis, Catholyte: KMO4, Anode: Aluminium, Cathode: Copper, Time: 24hrs
2) Best electrode combinations used in the simulator to produce maximum voltage ?
3) The maximum output voltage is obtained at what time duration when using the combinations PEM as Nafion, Catholyte as Water, and Graphite-Graphite electrode combination in the simulator

answers.a: No change in voltage over time

questions.question: 5) The maximum output is generated with which of the following combinations ?

answers.a: PEM as Nutrient agar with Bacillus subtilis and Aluminium-Copper Electrodes at 48hrs
answers.b: PEM as Nutrient agar with Bacillus subtilis and Graphite-Graphite Eletrodes at 72hrs
answers.c: PEM as Nafion and Aluminium-Copper Electrodes at 48hrs
answers.d: PEM as Nafion and Graphite-Graphite Electrodes at 24hrs
